You can embed an R code chunk like this: library('plotly') fig <- plot_ly( ) fig <- fig %>% add_trace( r = c(0,1,2,3), theta = c(180,225,270,315) ) fig {"

You can embed an R code chunk like this: library('plotly') fig <- plot_ly( type = 'scatterpolar', r = c(0,1,2,3), theta = c(0,45,90,135), mode = 'lines+markers', marker = list(size = 10,color="red"), lines = list(size = 10,color="black"), fill = 'toself', name='Trail' ) library('plotly') fig <- plot_ly( type = 'scatterpolar', r = c(0,1,2,3), theta = c(0,45,90,135), mode = 'lines+markers', marker = list(size = 10), fill = 'toself', name="Trail01" ) fig <- fig %>% layout( polar = list( hole=0.

item.title: Polarchart layout(

Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com. You can embed an R code chunk like this: library(plotly) fig <- plot_ly( type = 'scatterpolar', r = c(0,1,2,3), theta = c(0,45,90,135), mode = 'lines+markers', marker = list(size = 10), fill = 'toself' ) fig <- fig %>% layout() fig {"
